body:
in Examples.php file I try to send an image with this line:
$w->MessageImage($destinationPhone, 'http://questgarden.com/84/77/7/090712062416/images/Purple%20Mountain%20Magesties.jpg');

and a video file with this line:

$w->MessageVideo($destinationPhone, 'http://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/57066689/video1.mp4');
 
each at a time, but nothing happens in the browser more than the following echo statements of the examples.php file: 

start connect


tx tx tx tx rx rx rx rx rx #N�`��+F���W~$v� tx �� ��6 ���@������2�{�A����|p���_T�-h�0{��X��$ rx "k�0O�S�y���钙�x�� tx 


end connect





Start login





End login



giving that text messages work fine. 

the image is small and you can review it in your browser, the mp4 video is ~20MB in size.

I saw some old similar issues, but they did not solve the problem !!! 
do these features really work or not ?

comment_data.body:
Yes they work but I don't think that my changes have been merged with venomous0x repository
Try my fork instead https://github.com/shirioko/WhatsAPI
EVERYONE GO SPAM VENOMOUS0X TO MERGE MY PULL REQUEST! :D
Oh and here's the explanation on how the new upload works https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/issues/308#issuecomment-16299659

@shirioko I've tried the code in your fork with this line:
$w->MessageImage($destinationPhone, 'http://questgarden.com/84/77/7/090712062416/images/Purple%20Mountain%20Magesties.jpg'); in Examples.php
gave me the same result: the browser keeps loading for about a minute and (on Safari) eventually displays a Request Time-out Error ...
is there something missing should I add in order to get this thing working ?

p.s. your code works well with text messages.
p.p.s I've tried to call test protocol.php but it gives Call to undefined function getopt() error, because i do not have php 5.3 installed (which this function comes with :(

Works fine on my end, can you try doing the following:

add

    echo "<textarea cols='170' rows='50'>";
at the top of your page. This way you can see the debug information properly.

And use this code to test:

    $w = new WhatsProt($username, $imei, "Derp", true);
    $w->Connect();
    $w->LoginWithPassword($password);
    $w->MessageImage($target, 'http://questgarden.com/84/77/7/090712062416/images/Purple%20Mountain%20Magesties.jpg');
    $w->PollMessages();

I've already added PollMessages() to Message() but I don't think I did so for sending images. This should do the trick! ;)

Your output should look like this:

	rx  <iq from="s.whatsapp.net" id="1367824513-1" type="result">
	rx    <media url="https://mms832.whatsapp.net/u/n8LNrl85pGK26mcbJ8bvhSSMjscABNwHdbOKqA/Am8hqpKWftl6-7wHcHgTCIdcJI-W4QMaixmly_HjRRZo"></media>
	rx  </iq>

	tx  <message to="316********@s.whatsapp.net" type="chat" id="1367824515-2" t="1367824515">
	tx    <x xmlns="jabber:x:event">
	tx      <server></server>
	tx    </x>
	tx    <notify xmlns="urn:xmpp:whatsapp" name="Herp"></notify>
	tx    <request xmlns="urn:xmpp:receipts"></request>
	tx    <media xmlns="urn:xmpp:whatsapp:mms" type="image" url="https://mms832.whatsapp.net/d/Am8hqpKWftl6-7wHcHgTCIdcJI-W4QMaixmly_HjRRZo.jpg" file="a7a722c406bc1d0511e05a308a40790d.jpg" size="119100"></media>
	tx  </message>

	rx  <message from="316********@s.whatsapp.net" id="1367824515-2" type="chat" t="1367824506">
	rx    <x xmlns="jabber:x:event">
	rx      <id>1367824515-2</id>
	rx      <server></server>
	rx    </x>
	rx  </message>

Oh and P.S.:
You can comment out line 4 & 5 in testprotocol.php, nobody uses it anymore. I'll do a cleanup of the code when I get to it, also removing the unused python code.

same problem even after adding $w->PollMessages(); right after $w->MessageImage, however, sending a text message with your fork gives this debug info:
p.s. i wonder why tags do not appear after i insert the comment here, I've added pre & code tags to display but to no avail ...

Well if you did as I suggested you would be able to see the actual nodes instead of just bodies. Since you view the output in a browser it will process the \<tags> as HTML tags so you won't see them unless you put them in a \<textarea> element.

image sending still does not work ... text messages works without problems ... :(

-----------------------
<textarea>
Well if you did as I suggested you would be able to see the actual nodes instead of just bodies. Since you view the output in a browser it will process the <tags> as HTML tags so you won't see them unless you put them in a <textarea> element.
</textarea>
---------------------
I can see the tags in my browser, but i meant that I'm trying to display these tags here in this comment editor.
Can you try sending a local file instead of a URL?

yes, that's what im trying, this is the debug info for a local file: how the hell can i display the whole tags in this s h i t editor ! sounds there is something wrong with mime_content_type() function ..

You have to enable the php_fileinfo extension.

I've added replacing mime_file_type with a homebrew function to my todo list
unfortunately php_fileinfo extension is unavailable for php 5.2 (which is my installed version), i will update it and try to send a local file and post the result here ASAP.
would you tell me how to paste the debug info here with tags so you can see them all as you did above .. everytime i  paste the output and preview it, the editor shows only the bodies ...

here is a screenshot for the last two code blocks of the debug info after trying to send a local image:

![test](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1199045/465262/f1de6e42-b62a-11e2-85f1-6d084a8fb870.png)

Like this:

<derp />

here is the full debug info: ```xml


start connect

tx tx tx rx rx rx rx tx tx tx rx rx rx tx tx tx rx rx rx rx rx rx rx tx tx tx tx tx tx tx  tx rx rx rx 1367829792-2 rx rx rx ``` from the last block, there is some error I guess ...

Uhm did you notice this line in your image message node?

    <message to="@s.whatsapp.net" type="chat" id="1367829792-2" t="1367829792">
your contact phone number is empty :')

;) that's why I should sleep well at night ... 
i will update php to 5.3 or 5.4 and try videos as well ...
thanks a million ...

Please note that in whatsprot.class.php:

Line 1131	 has:    
```php
protected function getMediaFile($filepath, $maxsizebytes = 1048576)
```
Note that by default all videos/images/audio are limited to 1meg. You will have to supply a new value for this if you wish to send something bigger.....but I have no idea what size whatsapp servers allow.

Use at your own risk!

Does this limit us to only: jpg, mp4, wav ?

I know I've tested other formats (png, avi, 3gp) and they seem to work. Is this a WP7 limitation only I wonder?

There's definately a video size limit. I'm sure I've seen it on the official iphone client when I tried to send a large video one day to a friend....must go and look at that again,

I've tried to send an MP4 video (size 1.5 mb), I've placed it locally under demo folder, and when I call: $w->MessageVideo($destinationPhone, 'demo/test.mp4'); the debug info is: ```xml


start connect


tx tx tx tx rx rx rx rx rx §ïº˜ô¥{/‡J|Ò*ÁÍ) tx „@ÁdæŠˆz#.þsÃ"k¹*¯"lóK|S¸6ÑŸµTìOO5�EÚ<Ã$Ò rx �á‚–dJM0KÎ9x‰Ä‹&½^EV tx


end connect





Start login





End login


rx rx rx rx rx rx ``` I have used shirioko's fork, and tried with/without pollMessages call but I didn't receive the video ... what's the problem ? and @shirioko I'm now on my other computer which runs php 5.3 with all required extensions (including php_fileinfo) and reverted back line 1214 to its original syntax like this: ```xml $this->_mediafileinfo['filemimetype'] = mime_content_type($filepath); ``` p.s. image sending works well now. p.p.s. I have hide my phone number with ****
I've only fixed image upload, I'll fix video and audio when I get home in a few hours.

Wait? Hold on are you still using this modified line?

```php
$this->_mediafileinfo['filemimetype'] = "image/jpeg"
```

The video/audio will never work until you find a way to replace the original mime_content_type() function with something that works on your system.

You're currently sending a video to whatsapp but telling them it's a jpeg. That will bork it.

@jonnywilliamson nope look at the last note in my last comment above.
I'm trying now your video and your modified line .. brb in seconds ..

Just tested a 7.5meg video:  http://download.wavetlan.com/SVV/Media/HTTP/MP4/ConvertedFiles/MediaCoder/MediaCoder_test3_1m10s_MPEG4SP_VBR_516kbps_320x240_25fps_MPEG1Layer3_CBR_320kbps_Stereo_44100Hz.mp4

(change the maxfile size to 9 megs first) And it worked perfectly.

The idea behind the size variable was that at the time I wrote that code I didn't know how big a file size whatsapp servers would allow.

I therefore set it low to 1meg as a precaution.

Why don't you just set it to 20megs 20*1024*1024 and then you'll never have to change it again? 20megs seems fairly big to me....

As for the pic instead of video, I'll look into that. Hadn't noticed it on my phone.
well, setting the size to 20 mg is a good idea ...

Crap I forgot that Jonathan already fixed video and audio upload, too many projects going on in this madness filled brain of mine :')

I also received a notification of received image on my WP7 device when I sent the video file.

Another bug is that we use getimagesize() on the video file which consequently results in some divide by zero errors.

HA FOUND IT
```xml
<message to="316********@s.whatsapp.net" type="chat" id="1367886159-2" t="1367886159">
    <x xmlns="jabber:x:event">
      <server></server>
    </x>
    <notify xmlns="urn:xmpp:whatsapp" name="Herp"></notify>
    <request xmlns="urn:xmpp:receipts"></request>
    <media xmlns="urn:xmpp:whatsapp:mms" type="image" url="https://mms922.whatsapp.net/d/AhzY5RNuBhkgtTT9MkFu1QVJCu8pGiz8asWt1p1SIfO_.mp4" file="AhzY5RNuBhkgtTT9MkFu1QVJCu8pGiz8asWt1p1SIfO_.mp4" size="7347284">
preview
</media>
</message>
```
media type=image, should change this to type=video. Fixed in commit https://github.com/shirioko/WhatsAPI/commit/c7d7e761aa779dc54e0f12bf81dcbb760d3df291
awesome ... I'm gonna grab the latest update ;)

I'd go with the idea that your video is too big. You're probably abusing the whatsapp servers. DO you really need to send 22Megs of video via a messaging system?
Official WhatsApp client's maximum size is 16MB

Where did you dig that info from @shirioko?

Do you have the limits for audio and images too handy?

http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=1624514

    In addition you can increase upload media limit (stock limit is 16Mb) to send large music files or videos
No I haven't, but I think it's only for android.
https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/commit/2172cc1ceb137af01fe2de3f3fa99261deefa980

Fatal error:  Maximum execution time of 10 seconds exceeded in C:\xampp\htdocs\WhatsAPI-shirioko\WhatsAPI-master\src\php\whatsprot.class.php on line 1721.

when i am trying to send video or image it gives me this error!!any help plz
Its because the time limit, if you want to use without restriction, use the script in terminal/shell
ok done thx alot.

title: sending image/video not working
